ai.grakn.graql.internal.template

Class Scope

  • java.lang.Object
    • ai.grakn.graql.internal.template.Scope

  • public class Scope
extends Object
    Represents a scope (association of name to a value) and corresponds to a block in the TemplateVisitor class. This can also be thought of as a block in Graql Temaplates. I.e. any body of text surrounded by {} or the root.
    Author:
    alexandraorth

    • Method Detail

      • up

        public Scope up()
        Move up one level to the parent scope
        Returns:
        the parent scope

      • assign

        public void assign(String prefix,
                   Object value)
        Associate a value with the given key. If the given value is a map, recurse through it and concatenate the given prefix with the keys in the map separated by ".".
        Parameters:
        prefix - key to use in the map of values.
        value - value to associate.

      • unassign

        public void unassign(String prefix)
        Remove a key/value pair from this scope
        Parameters:
        prefix - key to remove from the scope

      • resolve

        public Object resolve(String var)
        Retrieve the value of a key from this scope, or the parent scope if it is not present in the current one.
        Parameters:
        var - key to retrieve
        Returns:
        value associated with the provided key

      • isGlobalScope

        public boolean isGlobalScope()
        Check if this scope is "global", i.e. has no parent
        Returns:
        true if this is the "root" scope

      • hasSeen

        public boolean hasSeen(String variable)
        Check if the variable has been seen before in this scope
        Parameters:
        variable - variable to check the presence of
        Returns:
        true if the variable has been seen, false otherwise

      • markAsSeen

        public void markAsSeen(String variable)
        Mark a variable as seen within this scope
        Parameters:
        variable - variable to mark as seen
